scenarioDescription:
The LP 714-47 Exoplanetary System


Overview

LP 714-47 is a star with 0.59 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.58 times its radius. It is located 171.61 light years away from the solar system.

LP 714-47 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the LP 714-47 system


LP 714-47 b

LP 714-47 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2020-11, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of LP 714-47 b is 30.817 times the mass of Earth. The radius of LP 714-47 b is 4.700 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, LP 714-47 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system LP 714-47, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: LP 714-47 - System With 1 Exoplanet
